Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Account Officer will support the Company&rsquo;s accounting, financial, and tax operations by maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring timely processing of transactions, and managing tax obligations in compliance with applicable regulations.
	The role requires accuracy, confidentiality, discipline, and strong communication.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting &amp; Finance:


	Record and maintain accurate financial transactions, including income, expenses, payments, and receipts

	Ensure timely remittance of all statutory deductions to relevant tax authorities

	Support tax audits, assessments, and compliance reviews
	Monitor changes in tax regulations and ensure Company compliance.


General Duties:


	Liaise with vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on financial matters
	Ensure strict compliance with Company financial and tax policies

	This is a&nbsp;hybrid role&nbsp;and&nbsp;not fully remote

Account Officer Job at BridgeHedge Limited




        
    

        
        At BridgeHedge, we build businesses, transform industries, and shape futures. We are a dynamic management services and consulting firm committed to helping organizations unlock their potential and achieve sustainable growth. Through a blend of management consulting, financial advisory, and portfolio growth strategies, we partner with visionary leaders and enterprises to bridge the gap between ideas and impact. Our mission is to empower businesses to scale efficiently, innovate confidently, and thrive in an ever-evolving market landscape. Whether it’s optimizing operations, driving investment growth, or crafting expansion strategies, BridgeHedge stands at the intersection of insight and execution, turning possibilities into measurable success.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Account Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Account Officer will support the Company’s accounting, financial, and tax operations by maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring timely processing of transactions, and managing tax obligations in compliance with applicable regulations.
	The role requires accuracy, confidentiality, discipline, and strong communication.


Key Responsibilities
Accounting & Finance:


	Record and maintain accurate financial transactions, including income, expenses, payments, and receipts
	Manage accounts payable and receivable
	Prepare payment vouchers, invoices, and receipts
	Reconcile bank statements and company accounts
	Support payroll preparation and salary documentation
	Track expenses and assist with budget monitoring
	Prepare basic financial reports for Management review
	Ensure proper filing and documentation of financial records.


Tax Management:


	Compute, prepare, and file applicable taxes (e.g., PAYE, VAT, WHT, and other statutory taxes)
	Ensure timely remittance of all statutory deductions to relevant tax authorities
	Maintain accurate tax records and documentation
	Liaise with tax authorities and consultants when required
	Support tax audits, assessments, and compliance reviews
	Monitor changes in tax regulations and ensure Company compliance.


General Duties:


	Liaise with vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on financial matters
	Ensure strict compliance with Company financial and tax policies
	Respond promptly to Management’s financial and tax-related requests.


Hybrid Work Requirement:


	This is a hybrid role and not fully remote
	The Account Officer must resume physically at the office two (2) days per weekon designated days
	Physical attendance is mandatory and forms part of performance evaluation
	Logistics and transportation for office resumption are the responsibility of the staff member.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Proven experience in accounting and basic tax management
	Good knowledge of accounting principles and Nigerian tax regulations
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting software
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	High level of integrity and confidentiality
	Ability to meet deadlines and work with minimal supervision
	Good communication and organizational skills.


Professional Expectations:


	Strict adherence to the Company’s Code of Conduct
	Timely response to official communications during work hours
	Professional conduct and accountability at all times.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: careers@bridgehegde.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Senior Brand Manager Job at Deloxe HR




        
    

        
        Deloxe HR - Our client, a fast-growing FMCG dairy company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Brand Manager

Job Location: Lagos 

Description
     

            
    




	Our client, a fast-growing FMCG dairy company, is seeking a Senior Brand Manager with proven expertise in end-to-end milk product innovation.
	This is a strategic brand leadership role, not a marketing communications position.
	The role owns the full product journey from concept and formulation alignment to manufacturing scale-up and market launch with a clear mandate to build profitable, scalable milk brands.


Key Accountabilities


	Own the new milk product pipeline from concept approval through commercialization.
	Define brand and innovation strategy using market and consumer insights.
	Lead cross-functional execution across R&D, Quality, Finance, Supply Chain, and manufacturing partners.
	Drive commercial performance through robust business cases, pricing, COGS, and margin management.
	Enable manufacturing readiness and scalable production.


Success Measures


	Majority of revenue from products launched within the last 12–24 months.
	On-time product launches with strong first-year margins.
	High concept-to-launch conversion rate.
	Zero regulatory or compliance failures.


Candidate Profile


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	5–8+ years of experience in FMCG brand management and product development.
	Strong preference for dairy or perishable food/beverage (milk) experience.
	Proven track record of launching and scaling products end-to-end.
	Degree in Food Science, Dairy Science, Business, Marketing, or related field.
	Strong commercial, financial, regulatory, and project leadership capability.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their applications to: recruitment.globallinkers@gmail.com using "Senior Brand Manager'' as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only candidates with demonstrable dairy/FMCG product leadership experience will be considered.

  "description": "Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the &quot;go to&quot; Quality Assurance &amp; Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Backend Engineer (Node.js / TypeScript)

Job Location:&nbsp;Magodo Phase 1, Lagos
Work Type: Hybrid (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays)
Type:&nbsp;Full-Time
Platform: MarketEdge Growth Platform (IDURAR-based)

The Role


	We are looking for a Mid to Senior Backend Engineer&nbsp;to join our hybrid work team&nbsp;and to own the architecture of our &quot;Growth Engine.&quot;
	You will move beyond simple CRUD APIs to build complex Event-Driven Systems, Offline Sync Protocols, and High-Volume Marketing Queues.
	You will work closely with the Solution Architect and the rest of the development team to ensure our platform is fast, resilient in low-bandwidth environments, and capable of delivering real-time Customer Intelligence (CI).


Key Responsibilities


	Core Architecture:&nbsp;Lead the migration of our Modular Monolith (Express.js) towards a structured, Service-Oriented architecture (NestJS/TypeScript) to support scale.
	High-Volume Queues:&nbsp;Design and implement robust background job processing using Redis &amp; BullMQ&nbsp;to handle marketing blasts (SMS/WhatsApp/Email) without blocking the main API thread.
	Offline Synchronization:&nbsp;Build the &quot;Sync Service&quot; that handles data conflict resolution and delta updates between our MongoDB&nbsp;backend and the React Native&nbsp;(WatermelonDB) mobile app.
	Customer Intelligence Engine:&nbsp;Write complex MongoDB Aggregation pipelines to calculate real-time RFM (Recency, Frequency, Monetary)&nbsp;scores and Customer Health metrics.
	Integrations:&nbsp;Build secure, scalable integrations with third-party providers including Paystack/Flutterwave&nbsp;(Payments), Meta Graph API&nbsp;(Social), and Africa&rsquo;s Talking&nbsp;(SMS).
	API Design:&nbsp;Develop flexible GraphQL&nbsp;and REST&nbsp;endpoints that allow our frontend to fetch &quot;Customer 360&quot; data efficiently.
	Quality &amp; Security:&nbsp;Enforce TypeScript&nbsp;strict typing, write comprehensive unit/integration tests (Jest), and ensure multi-tenant data isolation at the middleware level.


Requirements
Technical &quot;Must Haves&quot;:


	4+ years&nbsp;of backend engineering experience with Node.js.
	TypeScript Expert:&nbsp;You don&#39;t just use any; you understand generics, interfaces, and strict type safety.
	Database Mastery:&nbsp;Deep experience with MongoDB&nbsp;(Schema design, Indexing, and Aggregation pipelines). You know how to model data for performance.
	Message Queues:&nbsp;Proven experience with Redis&nbsp;(caching and queuing with BullMQ/Sidekiq equivalent).
	API Standards:&nbsp;Strong grasp of RESTful principles and GraphQL schema design.


Technical &quot;Nice to Haves&quot;:


	Experience with NestJS&nbsp;framework.
	Familiarity with the IDURAR&nbsp;open-source ERP platform.
	Experience building Offline-First&nbsp;applications (Sync protocols).
	Knowledge of Docker&nbsp;and Kubernetes&nbsp;(DevOps basics).
	Background in AdTech, CRM, or FinTech&nbsp;in the African context.


The Challenges You Will Solve


	The &quot;Burst&quot; Problem:&nbsp;How do we send 50,000 SMS notifications for a client&rsquo;s flash sale in 5 minutes without crashing the dashboard for everyone else?
	The &quot;Offline&quot; Problem:&nbsp;How do we sync 500 new &quot;Quick Orders&quot; from a field agent&#39;s tablet when they reconnect to a slow 3G network, ensuring no data is lost?
	The &quot;Intelligence&quot; Problem:&nbsp;How do we calculate a VIP Score for a customer in real-time based on their last 50 transactions across different branches?


Why Join MarketEdge?


	Build for Impact:&nbsp;You aren&#39;t just moving tickets; you are building the &quot;Operating System&quot; for African businesses.
	Technical Depth:&nbsp;You will work with complex problems like eventual consistency, event sourcing, and high-concurrency queues.
	Agile Culture:&nbsp;We value shipping code that works. We focus on &quot;Definition of Done&quot; that includes performance on slow networks, not just functionality on high-speed Wi-Fi.

Backend Engineer (Node.js / TypeScript) Job at Tezza Business Solutions Limited




        
    

        
        Tezza Business Solutions Limited is a leading Software Quality Assurance and Testing multinational with a regional office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are a Software Quality Assurance and Testing Services provider. Our primary goal is to be the "go to" Quality Assurance & Software Testing company in East and West Africa while developing offshore resources to fill test automation positions (and other hard to find software testing capabilities) in the North America and European markets.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Backend Engineer (Node.js / TypeScript)
     

            
    



Job Location: Magodo Phase 1, Lagos
Work Type: Hybrid (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays)
Type: Full-Time
Platform: MarketEdge Growth Platform (IDURAR-based)

The Role


	We are looking for a Mid to Senior Backend Engineer to join our hybrid work team and to own the architecture of our "Growth Engine."
	You will move beyond simple CRUD APIs to build complex Event-Driven Systems, Offline Sync Protocols, and High-Volume Marketing Queues.
	You will work closely with the Solution Architect and the rest of the development team to ensure our platform is fast, resilient in low-bandwidth environments, and capable of delivering real-time Customer Intelligence (CI).


Key Responsibilities


	Core Architecture: Lead the migration of our Modular Monolith (Express.js) towards a structured, Service-Oriented architecture (NestJS/TypeScript) to support scale.
	High-Volume Queues: Design and implement robust background job processing using Redis & BullMQ to handle marketing blasts (SMS/WhatsApp/Email) without blocking the main API thread.
	Offline Synchronization: Build the "Sync Service" that handles data conflict resolution and delta updates between our MongoDB backend and the React Native (WatermelonDB) mobile app.
	Customer Intelligence Engine: Write complex MongoDB Aggregation pipelines to calculate real-time RFM (Recency, Frequency, Monetary) scores and Customer Health metrics.
	Integrations: Build secure, scalable integrations with third-party providers including Paystack/Flutterwave (Payments), Meta Graph API (Social), and Africa’s Talking (SMS).
	API Design: Develop flexible GraphQL and REST endpoints that allow our frontend to fetch "Customer 360" data efficiently.
	Quality & Security: Enforce TypeScript strict typing, write comprehensive unit/integration tests (Jest), and ensure multi-tenant data isolation at the middleware level.


Requirements
Technical "Must Haves":


	4+ years of backend engineering experience with Node.js.
	TypeScript Expert: You don't just use any; you understand generics, interfaces, and strict type safety.
	Database Mastery: Deep experience with MongoDB (Schema design, Indexing, and Aggregation pipelines). You know how to model data for performance.
	Message Queues: Proven experience with Redis (caching and queuing with BullMQ/Sidekiq equivalent).
	API Standards: Strong grasp of RESTful principles and GraphQL schema design.


Technical "Nice to Haves":


	Experience with NestJS framework.
	Familiarity with the IDURAR open-source ERP platform.
	Experience building Offline-First applications (Sync protocols).
	Knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes (DevOps basics).
	Background in AdTech, CRM, or FinTech in the African context.


The Challenges You Will Solve


	The "Burst" Problem: How do we send 50,000 SMS notifications for a client’s flash sale in 5 minutes without crashing the dashboard for everyone else?
	The "Offline" Problem: How do we sync 500 new "Quick Orders" from a field agent's tablet when they reconnect to a slow 3G network, ensuring no data is lost?
	The "Intelligence" Problem: How do we calculate a VIP Score for a customer in real-time based on their last 50 transactions across different branches?


Why Join MarketEdge?


	Build for Impact: You aren't just moving tickets; you are building the "Operating System" for African businesses.
	Technical Depth: You will work with complex problems like eventual consistency, event sourcing, and high-concurrency queues.
	Agile Culture: We value shipping code that works. We focus on "Definition of Done" that includes performance on slow networks, not just functionality on high-speed Wi-Fi.
